tit.cmt: 文中に名字の別表記がありましたので、漢字を表記しました。

sen.j: 久米部正親（くめべ まさちか、天保12年4月17日 (旧暦)（1841年6月6日）- 明治43年（1910年）9月25日）は、摂津国大阪出身の新選組隊士。
sen.e: Masachika KUMEBE (June 6, 1841-September 25, 1910) was from Osaka, Settsu Province and a member of Shinsengumi.
Masachika KUMEBE (June 6, 1841-September 25, 1910) was from Osaka, Settsu Province and a member of the Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: the Shinsengumi に訂正しました。
sen.e: Masachika KUMEBE (June 6, 1841-September 25, 1910) was from Osaka, Settsu Province and a member of the Shinsengumi.
A corporal.
A corporal.
A corporal.
A Gun Metsuke (an inspector of foot soldiers).
A Gun Metsuke (an inspector of foot soldiers).
A Gun Metsuke (an inspector of foot soldiers).
His surname was also written as 粂部 (KUMEBE).
His surname was also written as 粂部 (KUMEBE).
His surname was also written as 粂部 (KUMEBE).

sen.j: 維新後は猪野忠敬と名乗る。
sen.e: After the Restoration, he called himself as Tadataka Ino.
After the Restoration, he called himself as Tadataka Ino.
After the Restoration, he called himself as Tadataka Ino.
A First Lieutenant.
A First Lieutenant.
A First Lieutenant.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）に新選組へ入隊。
sen.e: He joined to the Shinsengumi in 1864.
He joined to the Shinsengumi in 1864.
He joined to the Shinsengumi in 1864.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）に戊辰戦争が勃発し、鳥羽伏見の戦いで負傷するが、甲州勝沼の戦いにも参戦。
sen.e: The Boshin War broke out in 1868, and he got injured at the Battle of Toba-Fushimi; however, he participated in the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma.
The Boshin War broke out in 1868, and he got injured in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi; however, he participated in the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma.
sen.cmt: at ⇒ in に訂正しました。
sen.e: The Boshin War broke out in 1868, and he got injured in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi; however, he participated in the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma.

sen.j: 会津戦争では軍目付を勤めた。
sen.e: He served as a Gun Metsuke at the Aizu War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He served as a Gun Metsuke during the Aizu War.
sen.cmt: at ⇒ during に訂正しました。
sen.e: He served as a Gun Metsuke during the Aizu War.

sen.j: 如来堂で新政府軍の猛襲を受け、山口二郎（斎藤一）ら旧新選組は離散。
sen.e: Caught in the crossfire of the new government army at Nyoraido, the old Shinsengumi formed by Jiro YAMAGUCHI (Hajime SAITO) was separated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Caught in the crossfire of the new government army at Nyoraido, the old Shinsengumi formed by Jiro YAMAGUCHI (Hajime SAITO) was separated.
Caught in the crossfire of the new government army at Nyoraido, the old Shinsengumi formed by Jiro YAMAGUCHI (Hajime SAITO) was separated.

sen.j: 久米部は敗走を続けて、同年10月、銚子で降伏した。
sen.e: KUMEBE continued to be routed and surrendered in Choshi in October of that year.
KUMEBE continued to be routed and surrendered in Choshi in October of that year.
KUMEBE continued to be routed and surrendered in Choshi in October of that year.

sen.j: 釈放後、明治政府に陸軍士官として出仕する。
sen.e: After his release, he entered government service as an army officer for the Meiji Government.
After his release, he entered government service as an army officer for the Meiji Government.
After his release, he entered government service as an army officer for the Meiji Government.

sen.j: 明治43年、仙台で病死した。
sen.e: Died of illness in Sendai in 1910.
He died of illness in Sendai in 1910.
He died of illness in Sendai in 1910.
He was 70 years old.
He was 70 years old.
He was 70 years old.
